Header snippet.description: Headers describe the format (the set of fields and their sizes) of each header within a packet.

Parser snippet.description: Parser (finite-state machines) describe the permitted header sequences within received packets.

Table snippet.description: Tables associate keys to actions. P4 tables generalize traditional forwarding tables; they can be used to implement routing tables, flow lookup tables, access-control lists, etc.

Control snippet.description: Control flow is expressed as an imperative program describing the data-dependent packet processing within a pipeline, including the data-dependent sequence of match-action unit invocations.

Action snippet.description: Actions describe how packet header fields and metadata are manipulated.
